## Contributors

We thank our community who contributed code, ideas, bug reports, and feature requests over the years!

Special thanks to:

- [Leonardo Collado-Torres](https://github.com/lcolladotor) for contributions to our GitHub Action workflow.
- [Michael Stadler](https://github.com/mbstadler) for contributing the reduced dimension mode in iSEEu
- [Thomas Sandmann](https://github.com/tomsing1) for supporting the development of iSEEhub, iSEEindex, iSEEde, and iSEEpathways.

## Code of Conduct
  
Please note that the iSEE project is released with a [Contributor Code of Conduct](https://contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.html). By contributing to this project, you agree to abide by its terms.

## Contributions and Code Guidelines

Contributors should refer to the [Bioconductor Packages: Development, Maintenance, and Peer Review](https://contributions.bioconductor.org/),
particularly the section [Shiny apps](https://contributions.bioconductor.org/shiny.html).

## A bit of history

First substantial [commit](https://github.com/iSEE/iSEE/tree/021e3e20cfdb194e511f8097ed544329bd46bcd6), on 6 December 2017, when proposals for iSEE functionality was fleshed out.
